detaileddescription.para: DataArray mostly used when using one cell per octree leaf.
first index is leaf id (curvilinear index along the Morton curve) last index is hydro variable
DataArrayBlock used when designing a solver with a block of data per leaf of the octree.

first index identifies a cell inside a block (left layout, from 0 to bx by -1) second index identifies the variable (rho, momentum, energy, ...) third index is the leaf id (curvilinear index along the Morton curve)
Note that we enforce Left layout here, since we plan to the Kokkos TeamPolicy with one team per leaf, so we favor memory locality inside a block.

detaileddescription.para:
Iterate over neighbors when current cell is a smaller neighbor
ndim
2D/3D
enable_different_block
specify if all smaller neighbors are guaranteed to be in the same block if true (i.g. cell-based or odd block size), getNeighbor_ghost() is used to find siblings if false, getNeighbor() is used because no tree search is needed
offset
is the offset that was applied to get current CellIndex
apply_neighbor
is a (const CellIndex&) -> void functor that performs an operation with each neighbor smaller cell
array
the array that needs to be accessed (mesh used for neighbor search in AMR tree)
number of sibling cells NOTE : level_diff() must be -1 NOTE : for example, neighbors in 3D are the 4 cells that are in contact with the original cell

Iterate over sibling cells
apply_neighbor
is a (const CellIndex&) -> void functor that performs an operation with each sibling cell
iCell
first cell from the bigger supercell (sibling with the smallest morton index)
apply_neighbor

briefdescription.para: Fills in block ghosts with neighboring data.

detaileddescription.para: This method is used when filling groups of blocks to copy the value of adjacent blocks. Here the "ghost" term refers to the cells surrounding a a given block. They might be outside of the domain, or not.

parameterdescription.para: : Array to read the data from
: Cell index in the frame of reference of the group
: Boundary conditions to apply when filling cells outside of the domain

detaileddescription.para: Helper method to encode a Morton key from the cartesian coordinates. Separate bits from a given integer "dim" positions apart and inserting zeros in between.
Encode / compute Morton key from integer cartesian coordinate (i,j,k).
In 2D, cartesian coordinates x,y can be as large as 2^32 (about 4e9) In 3D, cartesian coordinates x,y,z must be lower than 2^21 = 2097152
another 2d version of morton key

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint32_t ix, const uint32_t iy, const uint32_t iz)
memberdef.name: compute_morton_key

detaileddescription.para: another 3d version of morton key
Helper method for Magicbits Morton key decoding.

Returned value is encoded on 32 bits. In 2D, all bits can be significant. In 3D, only the last 21 bits are significant, i.e. the returned value must be lower than 2^21=2097152.
dim
should be 2 or 3
Template parameter allows to extract either x,y or z coordinate.

parameterdescription.para: should be IX, IY or IZ (from enums)

detaileddescription.para:
Iterate over each member variable for a set of states
I
start index (mainly here for metaprogramming purpose)
states...
states to read or modify. They can be const or not. Mixing state types is not advised
f
function to apply to each field in states of type f : (real_t(&), real_t(&), ...) -> void one real_t for each const State& in states... one real& for each State& in states e.g. state_foreach_var( [](real_t&, real_t, real_t){...}, State&, const State&, const State& );
a dummy swap device routine.

briefdescription.para: A wrapper class around MPI_Init and MPI_Finalize.

detaileddescription.para: Define arithmetic operations on States. States are structures containing variables for a cell (or a particle) needed inside kernels.

A state State_t contains N variables of type real_t. To enable arithmetic operators +,-,,/,+=,-=,=,/= as well as state_get<I>(state) and state_foreach_var() :
DECLARE_STATE_TYPE( State_t, N ) must be called to declare State_t as a state
An index for every member variable must be set with DECLARE_STATE_GET( State_t, <index>, <member> ) Every index from 0 to N-1 must be set See State_hydro.h for an example
Official MPI C++ API is deprecated : this is an attempt at making a minimal MPI C++ interface for Dyablo. This uses a modified version of MpiComm.h from trilinos

Arnaud Durocher
08/2021
See copyright of the original version.
VarIndex is user un FieldManager to translate Field names into indexes in multidimentionnal arrays This file contains everything that needs to be modified to add a Field to a global array.

** Read this before adding a VarIndex **
Fields in VarIndex are meant to be used for GLOBAL fields, meaning fields that need to be conserved between iterations
For local fields (internal to a kernel, used with a temporary array) only use local variables to store (unnamed) VarIndexes
Use temporary arrays inside kernels as often as possible to avoid storing many variables in U
To add an index: (1) add an entry in the VarIndex enum before VARINDEX_COUNT (2) add an entry in the var_names() vector
